resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

hengruo commented on issue #5303: ARROW-6408: [Rust] use "if cfg!" pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303#issuecomment-529064898
 
 
   Thanks, @fsaintjacques .
   + @paddyhoran 
   I built both my branch and the **master branch of original repo** locally on Windows 10 and Ubuntu 16.04. On Windows, they both succeeded but on Ubuntu, they both failed. I checked other PRs. It seems there is no passing PR for rust (either failed or waiting). 
   
   `lz4-sys` crate seems the bottleneck.

   > I checked other PRs. It seems there is no passing PR for rust
   
   [This](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5269) one passed 2 days ago (the CI failure is not for Rust)
   
   > On Windows, they both succeeded but on Ubuntu, they both failed
   
   They failed locally? Failed with what error (I'm on windows)?
   
   I wonder if something changed on nightly that is causing this.  Pinging others who might know..  @andygrove @sunchao @nevi-me @liurenjie1024

hengruo commented on issue #5303: ARROW-6408: [Rust] use "if cfg!" pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303#issuecomment-529176349
 
 
   @paddyhoran 
   
   Those are the results of building on apache/arrow master branch:
   
   ubuntu 16.04 + stable:
   ```
   error[E0554]: #![feature] may not be used on the stable release channel
      --> /root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/packed_simd-0.3.3/src/lib.rs:202:1
       |
   202 | / #![feature(
   203 | |     repr_simd,
   204 | |     const_fn,
   205 | |     platform_intrinsics,
   ...   |
   215 | |     custom_inner_attributes
   216 | | )]
       | |__^
   ```
   ubuntu 16.04 + nightly:
   get stuck on compiling `backtrace-sys` and `lz4-sys`.
   
   on windows:
   both stable and nightly can pass.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

nevi-me commented on issue #5303: ARROW-6408: [Rust] use "if cfg!" pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303#issuecomment-529210411
 
 
   Hi @paddyhoran @hengruo I'm checking
   
   ___
   
   I'm on Ubuntu 18.04, and have successfully built with nightly 2019-09-05 to 2019-09-08 under this branch. I was building with the below.
   
   ```bash
    rustup default nightly-2019-09-08 && cargo clean && cargo build --all-targets --release
   ```
   
   A recent build from Andy on another PR didn't seem to get stuck where the other builds did (https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/jobs/582348096). It failed for different reasons (unimpl trait member)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

paddyhoran commented on issue #5303: ARROW-6408: [Rust] use "if cfg!" pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303#issuecomment-529220803
 
 
   The AppVeyor build for Andy's PR was over 10m (almost 13) which seemed to be the threshold causing these PR's to fail.  @hengruo can you push a trivial update to re-trigger CI and see if the issue is gone please? 
   
   You can make a trivial change and then undo it as all your commits will be squashed when this is merged.

andygrove commented on issue #5303: ARROW-6408: [Rust] use "if cfg!" pattern
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303#issuecomment-529221693
 
 
   In https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6100 I have suggested that
   we pin to a specific nightly release, so that builds are deterministic, and
   we are explicit about updating the version when there is a reason to do so.
   
   FWIW a local "cargo test" after a "cargo clean" takes 58 seconds locally
   for me on master. I am on Ubuntu 19.04 and rustc 1.38.0-nightly (dddb7fca0
   2019-07-30).
   
   
   
   On Sun, Sep 8, 2019 at 10:52 AM Paddy Horan <notifications@github.com>
   wrote:
   
   > The AppVeyor build for Andy's PR was over 10m (almost 13) which seemed to
   > be the threshold causing these PR's to fail. @hengruo
   > <https://github.com/hengruo> can you push a trivial update to re-trigger
   > CI and see if the issue is gone please?
   >
   > You can make a trivial change and then undo it as all your commits will be
   > squashed when this is merged.
   >
   > —
   > You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
   > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
   > <https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303?email_source=notifications&email_token=AAHEBRGEVPTQGC4AHZ4BZQLQIUUUVA5CNFSM4IUDRWO2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOD6FUJQY#issuecomment-529220803>,
   > or mute the thread
   > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAHEBRAX7LDOUDWXF4M6KPLQIUUUVANCNFSM4IUDRWOQ>
   > .
   >
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: There are a few places in the SIMD kernels where we have to use "#[allow(unreachable_code)]".  In these cases it would be better to use the "if cfg!" pattern
fields.summary: [Rust] Use "if cfg!" pattern in SIMD kernel implementations

comments.body:
Hi, I am starting to walk through the Rust codebase and would like to contribute. I think this ticket is a good entry point. Here is my PR: [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303]

Any comments are welcome. Thanks!
